title: Infection Preventionist
company: Skilled Nursing Facility in Long Beach
description:
We are a medium\\-sized facility located in the beautiful city of Long Beach, CA. We specialize in providing short\\-term rehabilitation services and are proud to participate in Medicare and Medicaid programs. With a Director of Nursing and a Director of Rehabilitation at the helm, our team of dedicated nursing and dietary staff have received rave reviews from our patients. Plus, we’re proud to have a spotless record with no serious deficiencies or payment suspensions. Come join our team and make a difference in the lives of our patients!


We are seeking an Infection Prevention Nurse to join our team at a skilled nursing facility. As the Infection Prevention Nurse, you will be responsible for implementing and maintaining infection prevention and control programs to ensure the health and safety of our residents and staff.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Develop, implement, and maintain infection prevention and control programs in accordance with current guidelines and regulations
* Conduct ongoing surveillance of infections and outbreaks and implement appropriate interventions to prevent the spread of infection
* Develop and implement policies and procedures related to infection prevention and control
* Provide education and training to staff on infection prevention and control measures
* Collaborate with healthcare professionals to develop and implement infection control strategies
* Participate in the development and implementation of quality improvement initiatives related to infection prevention and control
* Conduct regular audits and assessments to ensure compliance with infection prevention and control standards and regulations
* Maintain accurate and timely documentation of infection prevention and control activities
* Stay up\\-to\\-date with the latest research and best practices related to infection prevention and control

 **Qualifications:**

* Current LVN license in the state of California
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in infection prevention and control in a healthcare setting, preferably in a skilled nursing facility
* Knowledge of current infection prevention and control guidelines and regulations
* Proficient in using electronic medical records and other healthcare software

  

We are committed to providing a safe and healthy environment for our residents and staff, and we believe that our Infection Prevention Nurse plays a critical role in achieving this goal. We offer competitive wages and benefits, as well as opportunities for professional growth and advancement within our organization. If you are a passionate and dedicated nursing professional with experience in infection prevention and control, we encourage you to apply for this position

title: Nurse Consultant
description:
**POSITION** **TITLE**
----------------------


The policy will provide the scope of the job description for nurse consultant support a group of nursing homes.

**Occupational Exposure**: Category II

**Department**: Nursing

**Reports to**: VP of Clinical Services

**FLSA**: Exempt

**POSITION** **SUMMARY**
------------------------

  

The Clinical Nurse Consultant assumes the responsibility for maintaining and sustaining for Performance Improvement (PI), system analysis, assessment, coaching, coordination and implementation of clinical systems and tools according Facility Policies and Procedure in coordination with its leaders to improve survey results and nursing home compare rating. The job promotes standards for assuring compliance with regulatory guidelines and the delivery of quality services within the long\\-term care units. The position provides oversight and direct support to facilities and corporate personnel in the development, implementation, and integration of performance improvement activities and quality care as well as oversight of survey activity implementation. The position involves responsibilities in areas of quality assurance, adverse event monitoring, performance improvement and reporting, analysis,


interpretation, education, evaluation and recommendations. The position personnel’s responsible for conformance to regulatory requirements, contractual obligations, and corporate policy by the facility's quality improvement program through detailed understanding and can skillfully use the techniques of system design, reengineering, project management, quality improvement, outcomes measurement, and statistical analysis.

**POSITION** **RELATIONSHIP**
-----------------------------

  

Collaborates with all levels of facility leadership as well as with facility consultants, physicians in assessing needs for survey management, outcomes measures of quality of care and facility star rating and provided related education. Liaison to facility leadership, interdisciplinary team, ancillary departments and facility quality management/compliance personnel as a resource in effecting performance improvement systems. Liaison to corporate personnel as a resource in providing education/training, establishing protocols, and monitoring of overall performance improvement activities in the facilities as well as assessment of quality service needs and the implementation of processes to achieve and monitor ongoing compliance and to assist the evaluation and implementation of performance improvement activities.

**QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------

**1\\.****PROFESSIONAL**


a. Current state licensure in the which the facilities are located and supported for.


b. Completed nursing program or equivalent required and graduated from an accredited school of nursing.


c. Strong background and deep knowledge of the Resident Assessment Instrument (RAI)


d. Proficient with the use of PointClickCare


e. Progressive nursing experience in the field of long term care with demonstrated leadership and teaching abilities.


f. Experience in SNF setting with knowledge of long term care regulations,


a. Demonstrated skill in management principles of planning, organizing, and directing.


b. Interacts with facility owners and operational management. May interact with patients, families and visitors in post\\-acute setting.


c. Carries out other tasks as requested where hands\\-on intervention and participation maybe required.


d. Current valid licensure to practice as a Registered Nurse in California


e. Current Basic Life Support Certification


f. Minimum of 5 years nursing experience required, 2 of which has been in supervision

**2\\.****PERSONAL**
-------------------


a. Must have strong communication skills, both oral and written


b. Must have knowledge and awareness of the care needs of the elderly and/or chronically ill.


c. Must have knowledge and ability to teach adult learners.


d. Must have basic computer skills.


e. Must be able to organize, analyze, investigate and implement principles of infection control committee.


f. Must be able to travel

**3\\.****POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES**
------------------------------------


Direct/Clinical Services


Skills in clinical assessment, identification of changes in condition and ability to effect appropriate interventions. Knowledge of regulatory compliance standards and, ability to identify areas of improvement and to formulate action plans.


1\\. Evaluates clinical practices and systems for delivery of patient care to determine areas for improvement and processes needed to effect changes in deficient practices.


2\\. Evaluates the facility’s compliance with state and federal regulations, hospital accreditation standards, hospital organizational standards, and corporate standards.


3\\. Assist in the development and implementation of regulatory, accreditation, and quality compliance survey action plans as needed.


4\\. Assists in the development of facility specific performance improvement plans to monitor compliance with survey plans of correction, those based on specific needs of the population, or those driven by organizations.


5\\. Assists the facility team in the data collection, tracking, analysis, summation, reporting, and monitoring of indicators which measure the facility’s ongoing progress towards improving identified aspects of care.


6\\. Receives reports and information from the facility and other facility consultant or support services regarding ongoing quality improvement activities and makes recommendations as needed to assure the adequacy and appropriateness of the current systems.

  

Leadership/Proficiency/Resourcefulness/Performance


Skills in getting work done through formal and informal direction and collaboration of others, with contributions from appropriate staff/groups when needed. Ability, drive and creativity in working with peers, supervisors, and customers. Manner in which expression of ideas, observations and communication skills effect abilities to accomplish goals. Degree of competence and commitment to self\\-development and development of knowledge for staff, peers and other professionals.

  

1\\. Provides support and consultation to departments, professional staff, residents and families, and contracted facilities to resolve problems in the provision of service, the assessment of needs, and information and referral as necessary to maintain positive working relationships and quality services.


2\\. Consults with facility quality assurance and performance improvement (QAPI) teams to facilitate open communication regarding specific requirements for facility specific plans, measurement tools, reporting schedules, and recommendations for improvement.


3\\. Provides training to individuals and groups on quality improvement principles and the development, implementation and monitoring of performance improvement plans.


4\\. Consults with assigned facility specific corporate personnel and professional resources to implement standards and baselines, procedures, and systems for mandatory monitoring and reporting of specific aspects of care, which may include designated CMS Quality Measures, survey trends, high volume/problem prone, and high\\-risk issues.


5\\. Consults with Information Systems to ensure implementation and effective electronic medical record software implementation and data mining necessary to establish and monitor data systems for internal and external reporting and tracking and trending of performance improvement information for each facility assigned.


6\\. Collaborates with the facility team for survey management and to assist in conducting compliance surveys, facility “clean up” operations and validation of plan of correction site visits as needed.


7\\. Provides on\\-site support to the facility as needed for preparation and during survey processes.


8\\. Communicates effectively (verbal and/or written) with facility administration regarding on site activities and other issues, as appropriate.


9\\. Assist in monitoring job functions and duties of the facility nursing leadership.

  

  

Administrative/Departmental Compliance

  

Standard: Degree of analysis and decision\\-making abilities, objectivity, evaluation, monitoring and fiscal compliance. Planning, organization and implementation of processes, policies and procedures, tasks, monitoring systems, and standards of compliance.

  

1\\. Keeps abreast of current regulatory standards, educational resources, performance improvement standards, professional standards, and policies and procedures, as required to carry out job functions.


2\\. Submits monthly written reports regarding significant compliance activities and operational issues. Submits information on support activities for each facility for incorporation into the monthly Customer Site Visit Reports. Individual Site Visit reports may be requested and assigned according to facility contract.


3\\. Participates in departmental meetings, ad hoc and standing, professional and advisory committees within the organization, contracted facilities and community as necessary.


4\\. Assists in the development, ongoing review and updating of departmental and organizational policies and procedures, compliance survey tools, and performance competencies and training modules for assuring quality service delivery.


5\\. Assists in preparing quality trending reports and/or outcome study information as requested and approved by Administration for reporting to contracted facilities, provider relations department, and surveying agencies in order to contrast current performance.


6\\. Maintains files for each facility visited that includes copies of tracking tools and systems.


7\\. Develops a schedule for conducting facility visits and other compliance activities, and coordinates with relevant facility and other regional personnel, as feasible.


8\\. Ensures fiscal responsibility and management of services provided within budget/expense parameters and organizational guidelines.


9\\. Supports the overall mission and goals of the organization and facilities assigned.


1\\. Performs other related duties as may be requested by the Senior Clinical Nurse Consultant and as requested by facility specific corporate strategic partners.


2\\. Tracks, trends and analyzes incident reports. Serves a liaison for facilities assigned to ensure that a proactive risk assessment is conducted for all identified high risk and problem prone issues.


3\\. Serves a member and/or chairs the P \\& P committee to provide suggestions and recommendations and review of policies and procedures submitted and assist in the program development process.

title: LPN Homecare
description:
**Licensed Practical Nurse Homecare**
-------------------------------------

**VNA Health Group**  

*Changing lives. Shaping the future of healthcare. Join us.*

### **Your Next Chapter Starts Here**


Are you a compassionate Licensed Practical Nurse ready to make a real difference—right in your community?


At **VNA Health Group**, we’re not just talking about better healthcare—we’re making it happen. As a vital part of our Homecare team, you won’t just provide care; you'll build trust, bring comfort, and help patients live their best lives where they feel safest—**at home**. We are looking for a Full\\-Time Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) to join our team. This position would be responsible for providing quality care and home health nursing care services under the direction of a Registered Nurse.

### **Why You'll Love Working With Us**

* **Up to $12,000/year** in tuition reimbursement – grow your skills, on us
* **Online learning \\& CE opportunities** – we invest in your development
* **Employee recognition \\& referral bonuses** – we see you and reward you
* **Mileage reimbursed** – because the little things matter
* **403B \\& 401a retirement plans** – your future, secured
* **Supportive leadership \\& team culture** – we’ve got your back, always

### **What You'll Do:**

* Bringing care plans to life under the guidance of an RN
* Teaching and supporting patients with preventative and recovery care
* Ensuring services meet the highest standards of quality and compassion
* Collaborating with doctors, nurses, and other care professionals
* Maintaining patient safety, documentation, and infection control standards
* Helping patients regain independence and dignity—one visit at a time

### **What You’ll Bring:**


You’re not just a nurse—you’re a difference\\-maker. Here’s what we’re looking for:

* A graduate of an NLN\\-accredited LPN program with an active NJ LPN license
* 2\\+ years of med/surg or acute care experience (homecare/hospice a plus!)
* Strong communication, time management, and tech skills
* A valid driver’s license, reliable transportation, and a willingness to travel
* A heart for care and a passion for helping others thrive


Working Conditions/Physical Demand: Working indoors and outdoors with clinical equipment and use of phone and computer; Job characteristics: Client and Customer contact

### **Ready to Move Healthcare Forward?**


Apply today to join a mission\\-driven organization that values your voice, celebrates your success, and gives you the tools to grow. Let’s shape the future of care—together.

  

In compliance with New Jersey's Pay Transparency Act, the total compensation range for this position is USD $50,000 to USD $90,000\\. When determining an offer, VNA Health Group considers factors such as the scope and responsibilities of the role, the candidate's work experience, education/training, relevant skills, internal pay equity, and market and organizational conditions. The total compensation range reflects the total package, including base salary, overtime, bonuses, add\\-on incentives, special clinical compensation, retirement plans, and all other benefits. For more details about our benefits, please visit our Careers page.

 **EEOC**


VNA Health Group provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
ETHIC – Excellence, Teamwork, Hospitality, Integrity, and Compassion – steadfastly characterizes our mission to continually enrich the daily lives of residents. We practice these principles with every task and interaction, from personal caregiver assistance to mowing the grass. At Touchmark, we say:
  
  

I AM AN ALLY • I AM A FRIEND • I AM A GIVER
  
  

Touchmark at Georgetown, located on 13 beautifully landscaped acres just north of Austin and south of Sun City, is the newest addition to the Touchmark family, backed by more than 45 years of senior living experience. Our vibrant community offers a full continuum of care, including Independent Living, Assisted Living, and Memory Care, all designed to support residents in living The FULL Life—on their terms. With thoughtfully designed indoor and outdoor gathering spaces, inviting terraces, and a strong focus on connection, wellness, and lifelong learning, Touchmark at Georgetown provides a welcoming environment where residents and team members alike can thrive.
  
As a Registered Nurse with Touchmark, you will enrich lives every day by ensuring our residents receive the highest level of dignity and care. You will have the daily opportunity to distinguish yourself by taking the time to be a positive presence in the lives of residents and their family members!
  
Schedule will be Sunday \\- Thursday
  
The ideal candidate will be trustworthy and compassionate, and will:
  
* Possess a current RN License
* 1\\-2 years’ experience working with older adults in a health care setting; geriatric mental a plus.
* Have a genuine interest in caring for elderly residents and working in a geriatric environment
* CPR/AED and First Aid certification (as per state requirements if it must be kept current).
* Enjoy being part of a team, as this person will work closely with a team of nurses to design and implement care plans for each resident
* Help oversee the care staff and assist them in making educated care decisions
* Be able to maintain patient and tactful composure when dealing with residents, family members, staff members and visitors
* Must exemplify the Touchmark values of Excellence, Teamwork, Hospitality, Integrity and Compassion
* Possess a willingness to continue learning and improving skills, as well as a commitment to confidentiality
* Ability to process care plans and other required documents in an efficient timeframe


**Benefits:**  

Touchmark is dedicated to providing the best for our residents, and it all begins with providing the best for our employees. That’s why we offer a competitive compensation and benefits package to our team members who work 30\\+ hours per week which includes:
  
* Paid time off (including holidays)
* Health, dental, and vision insurance plans for employees and eligible dependents
* Education assistance
* Bonus and retirement plans
* Health care, dependent care, and commuter Flexible Spending Accounts
* On\\-Demand Pay allows you to access pay as you earn it
* Employee Assistance Program
* Supplemental insurance options


We are looking to hire individuals whose values align with ours and who believe in doing everything they can to lead by example in safety, compassion, and empathy. If that sounds like you, we encourage you to apply.
  
  

Check us out at www.Touchmark.com.
  
  

We’re growing. Are you?

title: Hospice - Admissions Nurse
description:
Our Hospice team has immediate openings for a full time Admissions and Visits nurse available weekdays. You will work for one of the top Hospice programs in Montgomery county providing patients and their families with exceptional end\\-of\\-life care that supports dignity and comfort for individuals, peace of mind to families, and honors cultural traditions and customs.
  
  

**Responsibilities include but not limited to:**  

* Perform initial assessment of patients' needs
* Obtain fully informed consents before admitting patients to the hospice program
* Serve as a clinical resource for referral sources to patients/family members
* Facilitate end of life conversations and decision\\-making with the family or caregiver.
* Prepare and discuss with physician an initial plan of care for patients
* Deliver quality hospice and palliative care services to patients in their place of residence
* Represent our agency well when communicating with patients, families, and physicians.
* Schedule will be 4 days a week 10 hour days from 8:30pm\\-7pm.


**Position Qualifications:**  

* An active RN license to practice in State of Maryland, CHPN certification preferred, and a minimum of 3 years of acute care and/or hospice experience.
* Demonstrated knowledge and skills necessary to provide meaningful care to communicate with the terminally ill.
* Excellent communication and customer service skills; attention to detail; strong organization skills.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office 365 applications and EMR systems. Familiarity with Netsmart/My\\-Unity or Homecare Homebase a plus.
* A valid driver’s license and reliable, independent transportation to provide care to hospice patients throughout Montgomery County.


**We offer:**  

* Salary starts at $90,000\\.
* Medical/dental/vision coverage
* 403(b) retirement savings plan with match
* Work\\-life balance and collaborative team environment
* Many opportunities for personal and professional development
* and more...


\\#RNC
  
  

The Jewish Social Service Agency (JSSA) has been helping people across the Washington metropolitan area meet emotional, social, and physical challenges for more than 120 years. A nonsectarian provider, we serve people of all religious backgrounds, races and ethnicities, helping the youngest child to the most fragile senior, from individuals to entire families. JSSA provides services and support to nearly 31,000 individuals a year through our wide range of counseling, educational, specialized employment, in\\-home support, hospice and nursing care, and social services. We are a growing Agency and strive to be an Employer of Choice. As such we offer a competitive salary and benefits package, a healthy work\\-life balance, collaborative team environment and many opportunities for personal growth and professional development. We pride ourselves on our mission to be the first place for the Jewish community, as well as the community at large, to turn for clinical and social services of the highest quality that sustain and nurture all who seek assistance. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. AA/M/F/D

title: Part-Time Night Shift LPN
description:
**Location:** Lawrence, KS


**Employment Type:** Part\\-time Nightshift


**Company Overview:**



Avalon Wellness and Recovery Center is a dedicated drug and alcohol rehabilitation facility committed to providing exceptional care and support to individuals on their journey to recovery. Our mission is to deliver comprehensive treatment services that foster hope, healing, and resilience.


**Job Description:**

  


We are seeking a compassionate and dedicated night shift Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) to join our team at our drug and alcohol rehabilitation center. The ideal candidate will have a passion for helping individuals recover from substance abuse and addiction. This job would require you to work night shifts from 7pm\\-7am, two 12 hour shifts a week.


**Responsibilities:**


* Provide nursing care and support to patients undergoing drug and alcohol rehabilitation


* Assess patient's physical and emotional well\\-being, monitor vital signs and symptoms, and administer medications as needed


* Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of healthcare professionals to develop and implement individualized treatment plans for patients


* Educate patients and their families about addiction, recovery, and coping strategies


* Support patients through detoxification and withdrawal process


* Monitor and manage patient's progress and adjust treatment plans accordingly


* Maintain accurate and thorough medical records and documentation

* Contributes to all aspects of medication management, including but not limited to; orders, administration, storage, documentation and as mandated by the State Regulations and Guidelines as well as Company policy and procedure
* Assures resident rooms and common areas are clean and safe at all times
* Assure that all resident care specialists are familiar with the residents’ individual conditions and are trained to provide the resident services in an effective, professional and sensitive manner
* Assist the residents with their self\\-medication or administration of medications
* Responsible Limited Nursing license daily recommendations and documentation (if applicable)
* Implements plans of care recommended by the Resident Wellness Director/Director of Nursing
* Implements change in condition plans
* Provides accurate and timely documentation of all care provided to residents
* Assembles and maintains resident charting and accurately maintains all records
* Completes accident and incident reports as required
* Maintains relationships with residents, family members and responsible parties
* Be prepared for and manage emergency situations including disasters, fire and other emergencies
* Ensures adequate and appropriately trained resident care specialists are available for each shift within company and state guidelines
* Must be in company uniform and resident ready at all times


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

* Able to communicate effectively with all levels of management, team members, residents, family members, vendors, referral sources and outside contacts
* Able to make independent decisions
* Must be able to communicate in a warm, friendly and caring manner
* Must be familiar with and adhere to guidelines related to the Fair Housing Act (FHA) and the American with Disabilities Act (ADA)
* Must possess a passion to work with and around senior citizens
* Knowledge of customer service principles and practices


EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

* LPN (Licensed Practical Nurse) or RN (Registered Nurse) license

EXPERIENCE PREFERENCES:

* Minimum One (1\\) year in the senior living, Assisted Living, Memory Care environment

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

* The following physical demands are representative of those that must be met to successfully perform the essential functions of this position:
* Able to stand or walk 75% of the day
* Able to concentrate with frequent interruptions
* Able to work under stress and in emergency situations
* Able to work under conditions that require sitting, standing, walking, reaching, pulling, pushing, and grasping
* Able to talk and hear effectively in order to convey instructions and information to residents and team members
* Occasionally lift/carry up to 50 pounds


OCCUPATIONAL EXPOSURE / PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT:

* Work in all areas of the community
* Subject to reactions from dust, disinfectants and cleaning chemicals and may be exposed to infectious waste, diseases and other conditions
* Use personal protective equipment and supplies when needed to prevent burns, falls, and infection
* Personal protective equipment includes infection control kit, rubber gloves, masks and non\\-slip shoes
* Subject to infectious diseases, substances and odors
* Follow Safety Policy \\& Procedures
company_description: Annually certified as a Great Place to Work, Watercrest stands as a beacon of quality senior living by creating a sense of family in a company where servant leaders collaborate to honor our elders.

title: Registered Nurse
description:
Registered Nurse  


Seeking Private Duty Licensed Vocational Nurses and Registered Nurses to join our team of nurses who are committed to the highest standard of care, integrity and reliability.
Hallway Healthcare **provides in\\-home nursing care** to retired Nuclear and Federal Workers that have received benefits through EEOICPA or FECA. These are the workers who have retired from Department of Energy facilities such Lawrence Livermore National Lab, Sandia National Lab Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, Stanford Linear, etc. We also serve Federal Workers such as US Postal Workers.


We offer flexible schedules, competitive pay, and 24/7 available support.

**Job Opportunities:**

* Palliative Care
* IV Therapy
* Diabetes Care
* Alzheimer's and Dementia
* Ostomy/Colostomy Care
* Wound Care
* Nasopharyngeal/TracheostomyCare
* Catheter Care
* Medical Gases
* Observation and Assessment related to patient's medical challenges and symptom fluctuations
* Teaching and Training Activities

**Required Education, License and certification:**

* Graduated from an accredited school of professional nursing.
* Current California RN/LVN License
* Current BLS Certificate

**Responsibilities/essential functions:** The person in this position must be able to perform the following essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodations.

* Perform the initial home care patient visit and re\\-evaluate the patient’s needs and progress on a regular basis.
* Initiate the plan of care under doctor’s orders.
* Perform assessments for the home care patient.
* Observe, assess, and document symptoms.
---------------------------------------
* Monitor reactions and patient progress.
* Educate patients and caregivers on disease processes, medications, plan of care, and individualized treatment plans.
* Educate patients and caregivers on techniques for in\\-home health care.
* Coordinate patient services.
* Notify the physician and other personnel (DON, PT, CM) of change in the patient’s condition.
* Perform skill outline in the agency’s approved policy and procedure manual.
* Case conference clinicians providing care to ensure coordination of care.
* Shall complete clinical notes for each visit, which must be incorporated into a record on a daily basis.
* Update clinical records according to policy and procedures.
* Update knowledge and skills by attending in\\-service programs, continuing education programs, seminars, and self\\-study programs annually.
* Provide onsite supervision of LVN/CNA.
* Adhere to state regulations.

**Schedule/Shifts:**

**LOCATIONS: Corona, CA**

**Available Shifts**: 12 Hour Shifts 7am\\-7 pm and 7pm\\-7am. Part\\-time and Per diem available


Other locations and shifts available!

**RN Daily Rate: $630\\-$709/day**

**BENEFITS:**

* **Medical Insurance**
* **Dental Insurance**
* **Vision Insurance**
* **401k**
* **401k match up to 3%**
* **Mileage 1 way after 30 miles**

**\\*\\*Insurance available for full\\-time employees. 401k eligibility after clocking 1,000 hours.**

**APPLY TODAY!**

**WORK ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

**The work environment and physical demands described here are representative of those required by an employee to perform to the essential functions of this job with or without reasonable accommodations.**

**Physical Elements**

* Sufficient clarity of speech and hearing or other communication capabilities, with or without reasonable accommodation, to enable the employee to communicate effectively;
* Sufficient vision or other powers of observation, with or without reasonable accommodation, to enable the employee to review a wide variety of materials in electronic or hard copy form;
* Sufficient manual dexterity, with or without reasonable accommodation, to enable the employee to operate a personal computer, telephone, and other related equipment;
* Sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, with or without reasonable accommodation, to enable the employee to safely lift, move, or maneuver whatever may be necessary to successfully perform the duties of their position;
* Sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, with or without reasonable accommodation, to enable the employee to efficiently function in a general office environment; and
* Sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, with or without reasonable accommodation, to enable the employee to efficiently function in a general office environment, with frequent travel to a variety of field sites.
* Able to lift 50 pounds

**Environmental Elements**


Employee works in an office environment sometimes with moderate noise levels, controlled temperature conditions and sometimes travels to patients homes where they may have direct exposure to hazardous substances. Employees may interact with upset staff and/or public and private representatives in interpreting and enforcing departmental policies and procedures.


Employee will have to travel to a variety of patient homes and perform in conditions that vary greatly depending upon the client’s home environment. Some homes will be clean, neat, and maintained at a comfortable temperature. Other homes may be cluttered, dirty, with an uncomfortable temperature.


The above list reflects the essential functions and other job functions considered necessary of the job identified, and shall not be construed as a detailed description of all work requirements that may be inherent in the job, or assigned by supervisory personnel. This job description is used as a guide only and not inclusive of responsibilities and job duties.

title: Registered Nurse (RN) Hospice Inpatient Facility Nights
description:
**RN Hospice Home Nights****Kate B. Reynolds Hospice Home**

**$$$ Sign on Bonus Available $$$ \\- Apply Now!**

 **Location:**


Kate B. Reynolds Hospice Home – 101 Hospice Lane, Winston Salem, NC

**Schedule:**

* Full\\-time Nights \\- 36 hours per week, 7:00pm \\- 7:00am with weekend rotation that includes 2 weekends in a 6\\-week track

**\\*\\*\\*Night Shift Differential Pay\\*\\*\\***

**\\*\\*\\*Plus, Weekend Shift Differential Pay on Weekend Rotation\\*\\*\\***


Trellis Supportive Care is North Carolina’s first free\\-standing not\\-for\\-profit hospice organization, serving patients and families in a Piedmont/Triad since 1979\\. Founded by a group of compassionate visionaries and community leaders, Trellis Supportive Care has remained a pace\\-setter in the region, state, and in the nation. Trellis Supportive Care has expanded over the decades to meet the regional needs of our patients. Our service area encompasses thirteen counties in the Piedmont/Triad and we operate from four offices plus the Kate B. Reynolds Hospice House. We have made it our mission to provide compassionate care for individuals living with a life\\-limiting illness and their families, through quality medical, emotional, spiritual, and social support wherever care is needed. Our staff has grown from a dozen individuals to over 350 specially trained professionals who work as a team to help patients live fully and comfortably, with hope — even during life’s most challenging time.

**Why consider a career as a hospice nurse with Trellis Supportive Care, formerly Hospice \\& Palliative CareCenter?**


* Provides meaningful and purpose\\-driven work
* Allows you the time to focus on patient\\-centered care
* Supports a culture built upon teamwork, values \\& a mission worthy of your time
* Enables work\\-life balance with 3 twelve\\-hour shifts per week

**Position Education/Skills/Abilities:**


* Current NC license as a Registered Nurse and current American Heart Association CPR certification
* A minimum of one (1\\) year clinical experience strongly preferred
* Excellent nursing assessment and problem\\-solving skills
* Excellent interpersonal communication skills, both oral and written
* Exceptional customer service required
* Sensitive to the needs of terminally ill patients and families and one’s own feelings about death and dying.
* Able to cope with emotional stress and be tolerant of individual lifestyles
* Computer proficiency with electronic medical records
* Share ours Values of Commitment to Patient/Families, Co\\-Workers, Professionalism and Communication

**\\*\\*\\*Trellis Supportive Care provides a comprehensive benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental, vision and 403b retirement plan\\*\\*\\***

**\\*For information about this and other positions contact Charlotte Akers, Talent Acquisition Manager with Trellis Supportive Care\\***

*\\* Annual flu vaccination is condition of employment unless an employee qualifies for a medical or religious exemption\\**

*\\*Employment decisions shall be made without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender, gender identity, and sexual orientation), genetic information, national origin, age, disability or veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law\\**

title: Director of Nurses
description:
**BrightStar Care is Seeking a Director of Nurses: Lead with Excellence and Compassion**  

BrightStar Care, a premier provider of home health care services, is seeking a Director of Nurses to guide and enhance our nursing practices. If you are a visionary leader who is passionate about delivering exceptional care and fostering a positive and collaborative work environment, we invite you to join our team.
Why BrightStar Care?  

* **Leadership in Home Health**: As a Joint Commission Accredited organization, we are committed to the highest standards of patient care and clinical excellence.
* **Supportive and Collaborative Environment**: Our leadership is dedicated to supporting your professional growth and ensuring a positive work culture.
* **Rewarding Career Opportunities:** We offer a fulfilling career path with opportunities to impact patient care directly, shape innovative practices, and lead a team of dedicated professionals.
* **Professional Development:** Opportunities for continuing education and professional development to stay current in the field.

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Lead the nursing department in delivering high\\-quality care that aligns with our mission and compliance standards.
* Oversee the recruitment, training, and development of nursing staff.
* Implement and review clinical operations and policies to ensure efficiency and compliance with regulatory standards.
* Coordinate with other departments to facilitate comprehensive patient care and administrative efficiency.
* Monitor patient care for quality assurance and implement improvements as needed.
* Develop and manage the nursing budget, ensuring resource allocation aligns with departmental goals.

**Requirements:**
* Current RN license and BSN required, MSN or relevant advanced degree preferred.
* At least 3 years of nursing experience, with previous experience in a leadership role within a healthcare setting.
* Strong leadership and organizational skills, with the ability to motivate and lead a team.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of effectively collaborating with staff, management, and external partners.
* Deep understanding of healthcare regulations, patient care standards, and ethical practices.

As the Director of Nurses at BrightStar Care, you will play a critical role in shaping our clinical services and enhancing patient outcomes. Your leadership will ensure that our care delivery continues to meet the high standards our clients expect and deserve. We look forward to welcoming a dedicated professional like you to our team at BrightStar Care!

title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
**Seeking Registered Nurses: Elevate Your Career with BrightStar Care!**

  

Join the dedicated team at BrightStar Care, a recognized leader in home health services, and help us provide exceptional care that makes a meaningful difference in the lives of our patients and their families.

  

Why BrightStar Care?  

* **Quality Driven:** Proud to be a Joint Commission Accredited organization and a recipient of the Enterprise Champion for Quality award, reflecting our commitment to the highest standards of care.
* **Empowering Environment:** We offer a supportive and collaborative work environment that encourages professional growth and development.
* **Flexible Scheduling:** Tailor your work schedule to meet your lifestyle needs with our flexible shift options.
* **Rewarding Benefits**: Enjoy rewards like performance bonuses, professional development opportunities, and wellness programs, designed to keep you at your best both professionally and personally.

**Job Responsibilities:**
* Assess, plan, implement, and evaluate nursing care for patients in accordance with professional standards.
* Collaborate with multidisciplinary team members to optimize patient care and outcomes.
* Educate patients and their families on health maintenance and disease prevention.
* Ensure accurate documentation and compliance with all regulatory guidelines.

**Requirements:**
* Active RN license in the state of practice.
* Previous experience in a home health or acute care setting is advantageous.
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.

Committed to delivering high\\-quality, patient\\-centered care.  
* 

At BrightStar Care, we recognize the hard work and dedication of our nurses and provide them with the resources and support they need to succeed. We are passionate about patient care and value the knowledge and skills that you can bring to our team. Embrace the opportunity to grow professionally and make a lasting impact at BrightStar Care!

title: Registered Nurse
description:
**Benefits:**
* Bonus based on performance
* Flexible schedule
* Training \\& development
ComForCare Home Care is a franchise of premier in\\-home care providers. We take time to understand the needs of our clients and work diligently to keep them safe at home. With ComForCare, clients can live independently and continue to do the things they love. As a Registered Nurse at ComForCare, you will conduct thorough client assessments, create personalized care plans, implement interventions to achieve client goals, update care plans to track progress, administer medications when necessary, maintain detailed client records, and coordinate referrals to other healthcare professionals as required.  


Learn more about how we show we value our team and why they love working at ComForCare.  


**Why Join ComForCare:**
* Treated with respect and dignity
* Ongoing training and development opportunities
* Flexible scheduling

  

  

**Make an Impact:**
After 20 years in business, we know the industry better than anyone. Make a meaningful difference by ensuring clients receive tailored care plans and interventions aimed at achieving realistic outcomes, improving their overall health and wellbeing.  


**What we are looking for:**
* Graduate of an accredited school of professional nursing
* Current license as a Registered Nurse (RN) in the state(s) of practice
* CPR certification
* Demonstrated knowledge of safety and infection control practices

  

  

**What you will be doing:**
* Performing comprehensive assessments of client status, including physical, psychosocial, and environmental parameters.
* Developing an individualized plan of care for each client that incorporates analysis of data and current scientific findings.
* Providing interventions with a focus on achieving realistic client outcomes.
* Reporting changes to update the plan of care to reflect progress towards goals and outcomes.
* Administering medications as needed.
* Maintaining client records showing systematic assessments, planning interventions, and evaluations.
* Initiating referrals as needed to other health team members.

  

  

**Salary Range:**
* $30\\.00\\-$35\\.00 per hour

  



*By selecting the positions below, you acknowledge that you are applying for employment with an independently owned and operated ComForCare franchisee, a separate company and employer from ComForCare and any of its affiliates or subsidiaries. You understand that each independent franchisee is solely responsible for all decisions relating to employment including (and without limitation to) hiring and termination, and ComForCare does not accept, review or store my application. Any questions about your application or the hiring process must be directed to the locally owned and operated ComForCare franchisee.*

**Salary Range:** $22\\.50 \\- $36\\.00  

  

**Job Summary**  

  

The Behavioral Health Targeted Case Manager provides case management and care coordination services for members identified as high risk, having ongoing mental health and/or substance abuse conditions or psychosocial needs to ensure care is appropriate, cost effective, and that appropriate resources have been identified and coordinated. The Behavioral Health Targeted Case Manager assists members in achieving comprehensive health care through assessment of needs, assisting with access to the right care, at the right time and in the right location, working to increase quality standards and outcomes providing opportunities to achieve the highest level of recovery and optimal wellbeing.  

  

The Behavioral Health Targeted Case Manager is tasked with providing services to adults who have been diagnosed with a serious and persistent mental illness (SPMI) or children who have been diagnosed with a severe emotional disturbance (SED). Mental health targeted case managers work with patients to assess and address the profound effects of housing instability, food insecurity, and other social determinants of health.  

  

Using a person\\-centered approach with the person served, the case manager assesses, plans, refers, coordinates and assists the person in gaining access to services.  

  

Must be self\\-motivated with the ability to work independently, a problem solver and fiscally responsible. Must be able to assess, analyze, summarize and present report data with effective oral communication skills. Must be able to multitask and work with little direction.  

  

**Qualifications**  

  

Must meet any one of the following three requirements:  

  

1\\. Qualifications of a Mental Health Practitioner (Associate Behavioral Health Counselor) with 2,000 hours of documented supervised work experience; or  

  

2\\. Bachelor’s Degree within Behavioral Health Sciences with 2,000 hours of documented supervised work experience; or  

  

3\\. RN (with no Bachelor’s Degree) with three years of experience in a mental health setting.  

  

**Benefits**  

  

Sanford Health offers an attractive benefits package for qualifying full\\-time and part\\-time employees. Depending on eligibility, a variety of benefits include health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, life insurance, a 401(k) retirement plan, work/life balance benefits, and a generous time off package to maintain a healthy home\\-work balance. For more information about Total Rewards, visit https://sanfordcareers.com/benefits .  

  

Sanford is an EEO/AA Employer M/F/Disability/Vet. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request an accommodation for help with your online application, please call 1\\-877\\-673\\-0854 or send an email to talent@sanfordhealth.org .  

  

Sanford Health has a Drug Free Workplace Policy. An accepted offer will require a drug screen and pre\\-employment background screening as a condition of employment.
